item.title: Judge orders review of BNSF's LA-LB intermodal transfer yard | JOC.com
item.description:
Judge orders review of BNSF's LA-LB intermodal transfer yard | JOC.com

A California Superior Court judge Wednesday found the environmental impact report on the BNSF Railway's proposed near-dock intermodal rail yard in Los Angeles to be inadequate, further delaying construction on a project that has been more than 10 years in the making.

item.title: US truck capacity still climbing toward peak, latest data show | JOC.com
item.description:
US truck capacity still climbing toward peak, latest data show | JOC.com

Net orders for Class 8 heavy trucks rebounded in December, rising 70 percent from November, showing demand for new trucks still exists. Year-over-year, however, orders are down, following a big surge in 2014 and early 2015 that increased U.S. truck capacity.

item.title: December Update
item.description:
December Update

According to the second estimate of gross domestic product (GDP) for the third quarter from the United States Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA), economic growth rose 2.1%, which is a faster pace growth than originally expected. This revision reflects that domestic demand continues to grow at a steady pace; consumer spending, business fixed investment, and residential investment aided in the boost.

item.title: Is Your Budgeting Process Killing Your Strategy?
item.description:
Is Your Budgeting Process Killing Your Strategy?

A friend of mine who had taken over running a major government department noticed right away how abused the word "strategy" was. "Everything has to be a strategy in order to get noticed," he told me. "You practically need a strategy for visiting the restroom."
